statement_text: Neither of these two cases [in the U.S.] has been an actual influenza infection as you think of a respiratory infection. They both [the two cases] have been basically either a nasal swab detection, for the previous one, or in the case of this one, a conjunctivitis—an eye infection. So this [the nature of these infections] isn’t classic influenza at all. The first one was just someone who was tested routinely.
